result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor L Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must call probation today, 9/6/2022, to sign up.

miscConds.notes: Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail today, 9/6/2022, to submit DNA sample.

Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 2 days credit if revoked from probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor L Davis

records.addlTxt: Return to Sender;  Not deliverable as addressed;  Unable to Forward. JOC
Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

10:19 AM Defendant Trevor L Davis in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Trevor L Davis.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Firkus relates matter is resolved.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  State moves to amend Count 2 to Possession of Amphetamine 961.41(3g)(d) an unclassified Misdemeanor. Guilty plea entered.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney Firkus relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:
 
SW 
1 year probation.  Must call probation today to sign up.
2 days Jail credit if Probation is revoked.
Must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Costs including DNA sample with 60 DTP.

Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail today to submit DNA sample. 

JURY TRIAL scheduled for next week is to be canceled.

9:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trevor L Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Trevor L Davis. 
Parties in a break-out room. 9:09 Case recalled. Formal reading of Information waived. Not guilty plea entered. 

Set for JT 9/14/2022 at 8:00 AM. Final Pretrial set 9/6/2022 at 10:00 AM. Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than 9/6/22. Must appear in person without petition of counsel.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Trevor L Davis appeared by video, Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Trevor L Davis. Witness appeared by video.
Attorney Firkus advises Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court questions Defendant. Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Next hearing to be in person. Address and phone number confirmed.
Arraignment scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 8, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

11:37 AM Prosecuting attorney John A Rafa Todd appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Trevor L Davis appeared by video, Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Trevor L Davis. Attorney Firkus relates, waives time limits, and requests preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing set and may appear by Zoom. Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
